content.text: How TO - Search Menu
Learn how to create a search menu to filter links with JavaScript.
content.html: Learn how to create a search menu to filter links with JavaScript.

content.text: Search/Filter Menu
How to search for links in a navigation menu:
content.html: How to search for links in a navigation menu:

Create A Search Menu
Step 1) Add HTML:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<input type="text" id="mySearch" onkeyup="myFunction()" placeholder="Search.." 
  title="Type in a category">

type="text" id="mySearch" onkeyup="myFunction()" placeholder="Search.." 
  title="Type in a category"

content.code_html:
<input type="text" id="mySearch" onkeyup="myFunction()" placeholder="Search.." title="Type in a category">

<ul id="myMenu">
  <li><a href="#">HTML</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">CSS</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">JavaScript</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">PHP</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Python</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">jQuery</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">SQL</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Bootstrap</a></li>
  <li><a href="#">Node.js</a></li>
</ul>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
<input type="text" id="mySearch" onkeyup="myFunction()" placeholder="Search.." 
  title="Type in a category">

type="text" id="mySearch" onkeyup="myFunction()" placeholder="Search.." 
  title="Type in a category"

content.text: Note: We use href="#" in this demo since we do not have a page to link it to. In real life this should be a real URL to a specific page.
content.html: Note: We use href="#" in this demo since we do not have a page to link it to. In real life this should be a real URL to a specific page.

content.text: Step 2) Add CSS:
Style the search box and the navigation menu:
content.html: Style the search box and the navigation menu:

content.code_html:
/* Style the search box */
#mySearch {
  width: 100%;
  font-size: 18px;
  padding: 11px;
  border: 1px solid #ddd;
}

/* Style the navigation menu */
#myMenu {
  list-style-type: none;
  padding: 0;
  margin: 0;
}

/* Style the navigation links */
#myMenu li a {
  padding: 12px;
  text-decoration: none;
  color: black;
  display: block
}

#myMenu li a:hover {
  background-color: #eee;
}

content.text: Step 3) Add JavaScript:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
// Loop through all 
list items, and hide those who don't match the search query

content.code:
<script>function myFunction() {  // Declare variables  var input, filter, 
ul, li, a, i;  input = document.getElementById("mySearch");
filter = input.value.toUpperCase();  ul =
document.getElementById("myMenu");  li =
ul.getElementsByTagName("li");  // Loop through all
list items, and hide those who don't match the search query  for (i = 0; i <
li.length; i++) {    a = li[i].getElementsByTagName("a")[0];
if (a.innerHTML.toUpperCase().indexOf(filter) > -1) {
li[i].style.display = "";    }
else {
li[i].style.display = "none";
}  }}
</script>

syntax_highlighting.text:
// Loop through all 
list items, and hide those who don't match the search query

content.code_html:
<script>
function myFunction() {
  // Declare variables
  var input, filter, ul, li, a, i;
  input = document.getElementById("mySearch");
  filter = input.value.toUpperCase();
  ul = document.getElementById("myMenu");
  li = ul.getElementsByTagName("li");

  // Loop through all list items, and hide those who don't match the search query
  for (i = 0; i < li.length; i++) {
    a = li[i].getElementsByTagName("a")[0];
    if (a.innerHTML.toUpperCase().indexOf(filter) > -1) {
      li[i].style.display = "";
    } else {
      li[i].style.display = "none";
    }
  }
}
</script>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
// Loop through all 
list items, and hide those who don't match the search query

content.text: Tip: Remove toUpperCase() if you want to perform a case-sensitive search.
content.html: Tip: Remove toUpperCase() if you want to perform a case-sensitive search.

content.text: Tip: Also check out How To Filter Tables .
content.html: Tip: Also check out How To Filter Tables.
